result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony E. Teubert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $443; due in $75 increments per month beginning 6/30/16 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment & AODA purposes; to commence
 6/10/16 by 5:00 pm

--0 days credit for time already served given

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

--To submit a DNA Sample upon demand

--No DL suspension ordered

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:02 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Anthony E. Teubert in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
Court finds that Mr. Teubert has been properly charged as/convicted as repeater

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for employment & AODA purposes; to commence 6/10/16 by 5:00 pm
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $443; due in $75 increments per month beginning 6/30/16 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--To submit a DNA Sample upon demand
--No DL suspension ordered
Recess: 2:12 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 11:02am. 
Defendant Anthony E. Teubert in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Strohschein indicates that an agreement has been reached in this case, however the Defense is requesting that the case be set for change of plea and sentencing in approximately one month. 
The Court grants the request. The Court continues Bond.
Mr. Teubert verifies that the County Trunk K address remains current. 
recess 11:05am

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on 6/2/16 at 1:30pm. -send notices

Case called at 9:06am [mo]
Defendant Anthony E. Teubert in court with attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Bond Remains as Fixed

recess: 9:07am


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/23/16 at 8:40am    (2)  Status Conference on 4/22/16 at 11:00am

Case called at 10:02 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Anthony E. Teubert in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; Mr. Teubert informs the Court that he would like counsel in this matter

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid doctor's prescription 
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 10:05 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 2/25/16 at 9:00 am  - Send notices **ADDRESS PLEA/SPEEDY**
